Sure, here are some examples:

Orthodox Judaism:

- The Orthodox community has placed greater emphasis on outreach and education to bring young people back to Judaism.
- There has been a growing acceptance of medical advancements, such as fertility treatments, within the Orthodox community.
- In some communities, there has been a greater emphasis on incorporating modern technology, such as using smartphones for prayer or learning.

Conservative Judaism:

- In recent years, the Conservative movement has become more accepting of LGBT individuals and has performed same-sex marriages.
- Conservative synagogues have been experimenting with alternative prayer services, such as using music and meditation.
- There has been a growing emphasis on interfaith dialogue and working with other faith communities on social justice issues.

Reform Judaism:

- As society has become more diverse, Reform Judaism has placed greater emphasis on celebrating different cultures and including non-Jewish partners in Jewish life.
- Many Reform synagogues have incorporated alternative prayer services that include yoga, meditation, and other mindfulness practices.
- There is a greater emphasis on social justice and environmental activism within the Reform community.
